intro: Papaver dubium subsp. dubium, commonly known as the lesser poppy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and produces delicate, yellowish to orange-red flowers. The plant has a taproot system and is characterized by its lanceolate, serrated leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas. The flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
